intro: Blumea laevis var. minor, commonly known as the narrow-leaved blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale blue to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks. Its flowering period occurs during the warm seasons, and it is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. The species is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
